results.title: Fine feathers
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this cut-out colour cartoon by film artist Evelyn Lambart, two quarrelsome birds get the urge to change their plumage. A bluejay wants to be decked out in the green of the cedar, and a loon in the burnished red of oak leaves. There is a moral to the story. Neither bird had reckoned on the consequences of vanity. Along comes a gust of wind and both learn to their consternation that their natural, well-anchored feathers offered better protection.

results.title: The Fine art of aggression
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, Ronald Shedlo and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Presents a story of one man’s ruthless determination to succeed in business at the expense of his co-workers. Shows how destruction of self and others results when an unthwarted will goes beyond the norms of reason. Edited from the Columbia Pictures 1969 motion picture entitled “The Reckoning”.

results.title: Finding information
results.brief_description: In learning to raise a baby bird a boy gets information in a number of ways: by advice from “an authority”, by observation, by consulting reference materials in the library, by doing an informal experiment and by exploring community resources. Imparts an awareness of the process of learning and problem solving.

results.title: Find yourself, then your job
results.creator_credit: Richard Siegel, Valentine Smith and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film presents career choice as an extension of the self and shows that work needn’t be drudgery. Using free-flowing documentary style, this film features six young people doing the work of their choice. It examines their values and motivation and shows that while some designed their futures, others found their professions by chance.

results.title: The Find me book: self help in action
results.brief_description: The Volunteer Emergency Reserve was established in 1965 and acts as a vital backup to the Victoria Police in emergencies. In 1974, the VER was called in to assist in the search for a young boy lost in the bush. This child was not found, but to help prevent further such tragedies the “Find me book” was devised. The distinctive orange colored pages of the book can be torn out and used by the lost person to mark their way. Points on how to stay comfortable in the bush are also given.

results.title: Finance in the balance
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellis, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”.
The financial problems of the smaller firm, including getting a bank loan, what the bank looks for before giving financial support, and how a businessman can control finances. Also examines some of the most common causes of mortality in small companies.

results.title: Finale
results.creator_credit: Michael Darlow, Robert Bas, Theodora Olembert and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: A nostalgic look at the Marlborough Music Hall in North London. It was demolished and we see this being done interspersed with photographs of the famous music hall stars who played there and their special acts.

results.title: The Final hour of Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: Bernard Girard, James Fonda, Columbia Broadcasting System and Young America Films
results.brief_description: One of the “You are There” television series, which reconstructs the events of 29th and 30th May, 1431, at Rouen. Spurred on by the English, who wish to ensure that Joan does not revive the campaign against them, the Church authorities press the interrogation of Joan, and next day have her burnt at the stake as a “lapsed heretic”. Includes Dianna Lynn as Joan. Written for television by Milton Geiger; director of photography by Ed Fitzgerald and narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Final game
results.brief_description: A stirring account of the championship game played by the Boston Celtics, internationally-known champions of professional basketball, against their challengers, the Cincinnati Royals. Using a variety of cinetechniques this film captures this exciting, graceful game.
